results.title: Touch the Sun: Devil's Hill
results.creator_credit: Esben Storm, Jill Robb, Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Australian Children's Television Foundation and Revcom Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series ‘Touch the Sun’.
Sam and his sisters come to stay on their cousin’s remote farm in Tasmania. Badge, the farm boy, feels daunted by the arrival of his arrogant city cousins. After a huge violent storm, the prize cow escapes. The children decide to search the mountainous wilderness for the cow and their route leads up to the mysterious Devil’s Hill. The adventure teaches them they must stick together to survive. Based on the novel by Nan Chauncy.
Cast includes Peter Hehir, Mary Haire, John Flaus, Alexander Jacobs, Emma Pugh, Cameron Atkins and Jane McArthur.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Peter and Pompey
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Peter, Margaret and Wayne discover a Roman boat in a cave that contains the manuscript of young Pompey. The discovery changes the tiny little town of Gamma into a brash, hyped-up tourist centre. The children also find that their lives change too - and they don’t like what is happening. The manuscript found in the boat reveals that the boat is cursed and, until the boat is destroyed it will continue to curse anyone who comes into contact with it. The children decide that in order to save Gamma they must finally carry out the drastic act of destroying the boat.

results.title: Work it out (Captioned)
results.brief_description: A video, aimed at young women between the ages of 14-20 years, that examines career opportunities available. The subject areas covered include : Women at Work; Careers Counselling; Equal Opportunity; Personal Development; Industrial relations; Social Studies.

results.title: What little girls are made of (TEFC)
results.brief_description: For over a century male scientists have been searching for evidence to demonstrate female inferiority. This program explores this idea and the effect it has had on the relationship between women and science.

results.title: Electric Visions
results.brief_description: A teenager at a video parlour plays a new video game. He climbs inside and tests his skills which lead him along the pathway of the development of electricity. Particular reference is made on the role of electricity in the development of Victoria.

results.title: Free Climbing
results.brief_description:
Rock climbing is a recreation for some, an obsession for others. “Free Climbing” was filmed at Mt Arapiles and Mt Buffalo and features hair-raising shots as climbers demonstrate safety and technical skills.

Since this work was made (in 1986) there have been significant rediscoveries of indigenous cultural heritage around Mt Arapiles (2019 - 2022). Some of the climbing areas pictured may no longer be accessible due to measures to protect this heritage.

results.title: The Siege of Barton's bathroom
results.brief_description: Elly Barton lives in a barren suburban housing estate where there is only one tree left standing. Now the neighbours want to cut it down, but what no-one seems to understand is that it is Elly’s tree - and she is not going to let anybody touch it. Stars Frankie J. Holden, Max Phipps and Rebekah Elmaloglou.

results.title: The Moving Record
results.creator_credit: Robert Rothols and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: A look at how film has been used to portray agriculture in Australia and particularly in Victoria between 1913 and 1985, and how film makers strengthened certain myths about city and country life. This compilation of old film footage was put together for the 150th anniversary of Victoria. Narrated by Sir Eric Pearce.
